definition: see 謎兒|谜儿[mei4 r5], riddle

sentences.english: Kiddies, let's guess a riddle before our class, OK?
sentences.chinese: 在上课之前，小朋友们，我们猜个谜语，好不好？

sentences.english: Tom Riddle would kill Lord Voldemort, and it would be the last thing he did.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆谜语将杀死繁简体转换，而这是最后的事情来做。

sentences.english: Write down the answers of the riddles below.
sentences.chinese: 猜谜语写出你认为正确的谜底。

sentences.english: The contemporary riddle culture includes sophisticated puzzles for both children and adults.
sentences.chinese: 现代的谜语文化中也有老少皆宜的精妙谜题。

sentences.english: Break into Riddler's secret hideout and exact your revenge.
sentences.chinese: 闯入谜语人的隐秘藏身所，实现你的复仇。

sentences.english: A series of riddles set in the mysterious Addle Valley.
sentences.chinese: 在一个神秘的腐坏的山谷谜语系列。

sentences.english: This riddle, has become the Internal Classic joke.
sentences.chinese: 此谜语，已成为警队内部经典笑谈。

sentences.english: He found out the riddle at last.
sentences.chinese: 他终于猜出了这个谜语。

sentences.english: He's interested in puzzles and he's interested in the cyphers that the killer sends.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢谜语，而且他喜欢杀手寄来的密信。

sentences.english: Listen, here's a riddle for all you smarty pants!
sentences.chinese: 听着朋友们下面是一个谜语。

sentences.english: The riddle was at last unriddled.
sentences.chinese: 这个谜语终于得到了解答。

sentences.english: She sang them lullabies and taught them riddles.
sentences.chinese: 她给它们唱摇篮曲，教它们谜语。

sentences.english: The first 33 palindromes were both riddles and profound.
sentences.chinese: 前33句回文既是谜语又很深奥。

sentences.english: I am no use at guessing riddles.
A riddle to guess? I like it.
I will turn my ear to a proverb; with the harp I will expound my riddle
sentences.chinese: 我要侧耳听比喻，用琴解谜语。

definition: riddles written on lanterns (e.g. for the Lantern Festival at the end of Chinese New Year)
saying in which the second part, uttered after a pause or totally left out, is the intended meaning of the allegory presented in the first part
Chinese set expression, typically of 4 characters, often alluding to a story or historical quotation/idiom/proverb/saying/adage/CL:條|条[tiao2],本[ben3],句[ju4]
pun/play on words/a phrase with a double meaning
popular piece of doggerel/common phrase repeated as a jingle
classical story or quote from the literature/the story behind sth
